attributes.action: review the age limits for free NHS prescriptions for students
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Currently, people in full time education between the ages of 16 and 19 can get free prescriptions on the NHS. This is the time when parents will probably most gladly pay for them, but they don't need to. Then 19 year olds come away to university and have to live independantly without as much support from their parents, and are expected to pay more than £7 for each item on their prescription. 

This needs to be reviewed, as there are students out there having to go without medicines which could cause serious illnesses, and could be potentially fatal
